WEREWOLVES.Definition: humans who have the power to turn into wolves

WOMBS.Definition: the organs in which babies grow until birth

STRANGLED.Definition: killed by having the neck squeezed or pressed

WEREWOLF.Definition: a man who had turned into a wolf

KEPT HIMSELF TO HIMSELF.Definition: didn't have much contact or socialise with other people

COMMOTION.Definition: a state of confusion and noise

PAWS.Definition: feet that had claws (big sharp nails)

ABSENCE.Definition: the fact that he wasn't there

FUR.Definition: the thick hair of the animal

GRISLY.Definition: horrible and involving death and blood

FLESH.Definition: the soft part of his body that was between the skin and the bones, tissue

RABIES.Definition: a serious disease that can be passed to humans by animals and affects the nervous system

SALIVA.Definition: the watery liquid produced in the mouth

HALLUCINATIONS.Definition: experiences of something that does not actually exist

FREAKSHOWS.Definition: shows featuring people that had not developed normally

HOWLING.Definition: producing long sad cries as wolves do

EXTINCTION.Definition: the point where there were no wolves living

FUELLED.Definition: caused them to be more intense

ANOINTED.Definition: covered in a liquid as part of a ceremony

CLAWS.Definition: sharp nails at the end of his hands and feet

RAMPAGE.Definition: period of violent and uncontrollable behaviour

TORE THEIR VICTIMS TO PIECES.Definition: destroyed their victims completely, caused extreme damage

BESTIALITY.Definition: sexual acts between humans and animals

RELEGATED.Definition: reduced, moved to a less important position

SCAPEGOAT.Definition: make them something that could be blamed or considered responsible for their acts
